name: Crab Savoury (Baked Crab with Bread Crumbs and Cheese)
description: Traditionally, the savoury course comes after dessert at the end of a large meal—just a few salty bites to have with a glass of port. This crab savoury is a simple dish, creamy salty crab topped with melted cheese, is designed to serve a crowd.
recipeIngredient: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

recipeInstructions.text: Adjust oven rack to medium position and preheat to 375°F. Heat butter in a medium stainless steel skillet over medium-high heat until foaming subsides, then add onion and cook, stirring frequently, until soft, about 4 minutes. Reduce heat to medium-low, then add breadcrumbs and cook, stirring frequently, until crumbs are jut beginning to toast, about 4 minutes.

Reduce heat to low, then add crab meat, sour cream, and cream and cook stirring often until all ingredients are heated through. Fold in parsley and season to taste with salt, pepper, and a squeeze of lemon juice. Place mixture in a 6-inch round pyrex dish, top with grated cheese, and bake until cheese is melted and mixture is bubbling, about 15 minutes. Serve with toast and ale.
